request_pathways.name: Authorization to Use or Disclose PHI (PDF)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patient uses a generic HIPAA authorization form designed for all disclosures, filling in their own name as the recipient, with Swellbox as an alternative digital pathway.

red_flags: Fee clause references Florida statutes without disclosing amounts or distinguishing patient access from third-party release fees
Witness signature line with unclear mandatory/optional status
Collects last 4 of SSN unnecessarily when MRN, name, DOB, and address are already collected
bright_spots: Swellbox digital intake wizard provides fully electronic alternative pathway
MyChart Patient Portal offered as a delivery option
Granular record-type selection with 13 categories plus Other field
Explicit sensitive information redaction option for mental health, substance abuse, and HIV/AIDS
Single-page conciseness keeps patient burden low

findability.rationale: Level 4: Easy to find with basic navigation or a simple search — form was immediately discoverable via web search and linked from a clear Medical Records page, with only minor concern about the outdated version remaining accessible.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: Usable digitally with workarounds; fax submission available — the PDF has a text layer but zero fillable fields requiring print-and-handwrite, though the Swellbox digital portal and fax provide electronic submission options.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized with minor clarity or length issues — single-page form with logical flow, granular record selection, and reasonable language, but fee clause references statutes without disclosing amounts and bidirectional authorization language is unintuitive for patients.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the process but it wasn't designed for them — generic HIPAA authorization form with no differentiation between patient self-access and third-party release, requiring patients to figure out which checkboxes apply and enter their own name as recipient.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: Some requirements or language that may go beyond what the law requires for patient access — witness signature line may create an unnecessary barrier, fee clause cites state statutes that may exceed HIPAA cost-based limits for patient access, and partial SSN collection is unnecessary.

overall.summary: Lakeland Regional Health provides an easily findable, concise ROI form with some patient-friendly features (granular record selection, MyChart delivery, Swellbox alternative), but the generic authorization approach, non-fillable PDF, undisclosed fees, and ambiguous witness requirement hold it back from a higher rating.
